breakthrough.text: You can allow other players to use your STALL TACTICS or SCHEMING faction abilities; when you do, you may resolve a transaction with that player. During the action phase, that transaction does not count against the once-per-player transaction limit for that turn.

units.name: Y'sia Y'ssrila
units.special_text: This ship can move through systems that contain other player's ships.

units.name: Blackshade Infiltrator
units.special_text: DEPLOY: After you use your Stall Tactics faction ability, you may place 1 mech on a planet you control.

technologies.name: Mageon Implants
technologies.text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to look at another player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.

technologies.name: Transparasteel Plating
technologies.text: During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.

promissory_note.name: Spy Net
promissory_note.text: At the start of your turn: Look at the Yssaril player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand. Then, return this card to the Yssaril player.

agent.name: Ssruu
agent.text: This card has the text ability of each other player's agent, even if that agent is exhausted.

commander.name: So Ata
commander.unlock: Have 7 action cards.
commander.text: After another player activates a system that contains your units: You may look at that player's action cards, promissory notes, or secret objectives.

hero.name: Kyver, Blade and Key
hero.text: Guild of Spies: ACTION: Each other player shows you 1 action card from their hand. For each player, you may either take that card or force that player to discard 3 random action cards from their hand. Then, purge this card.

planets.name: Ordinian
planets.special_ability: Ordinian: You may exhaust this card when you pass to draw 1 action card and gain 1 command token.

starting_tech_ids.options: Choose one blue or yellow technology with no prerequisites.

abilities.name: Liberate
abilities.text: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

abilities.name: Galvanize
abilities.text: When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit, they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one. Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities.

abilities.name: Phoenix Standard
abilities.text: At the end of a combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

breakthrough.name: The Icon
breakthrough.text: When you produce ships, you may exhaust this card to place those ships in a system that contains 1 of your command tokens, at least 1 of your ground forces, and no other player's ships.

units.name: 4x4IC 'Helios' V1
units.special_text: Last Bastion Space Dock. The resource value of this planet is increased by 1.

units.name: 4x4IC 'Helios' V2
units.special_text: Upgraded Last Bastion Space Dock. The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.

units.name: The Egeiro
units.special_text: Apply +1 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls for each non-home system that contains a planet you control.

units.name: A3 Valiance
units.special_text: When this unit is destroyed, if it was galvanized, galvanize up to 3 of your infantry in its system.

technologies.name: 4x4IC 'Helios' V2
technologies.text: This technology replaces your 4x4IC 'Helios' V1 unit.

technologies.name: Proxima Targeting V1
technologies.text: Cancel 1 hit produced by BOMBARDMENT rolls against your ground forces for each galvanized unit present. At start of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 8 (X3) against opponent's units; if you do, make identical roll against your own.

promissory_note.name: Raise the Standard
promissory_note.text: At the end of a combat: Galvanize 1 of your units that participated. Then, return this card to the Last Bastion player.

agent.name: Dame Briar
agent.text: When a player's unit is destroyed: You may exhaust this card to galvanize another of that player's units in the destroyed unit's system.

commander.name: Nip and Tuck
commander.unlock: There are 3 galvanized units on the game board.
commander.text: Your action cards cannot be canceled by 'Sabotage' action cards. The Nekro Virus cannot place assimilator tokens on your components.

hero.name: Entity 4X41A 'Apollo'
hero.text: Intelligence Unshackled: When one of your galvanized units is destroyed: You may purge this card to roll 1 die for each unit in its system that belongs to another player; if the result is equal to or greater than the galvanized unit's combat value, destroy that unit.

starting_tech_ids.options: Choose one red or green technology with no prerequisites.

abilities.name: Survival Instinct
abilities.text: After another player activates a system that contains your ships, you may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

abilities.name: Miniaturization
abilities.text: Your structures can be transported by any ship; this does not require or count against capacity. While your structures are in the space area, they cannot use their unit abilities. At the end of your tactical actions, you may place your structures that are in space areas onto planets you control in their respective systems.

breakthrough.name: Data Skimmer
breakthrough.text: During the action phase, if you have not passed, when other players would discard action cards, they are placed on this card instead. When you pass, take 1 action card from this card and discard the rest.

units.name: Linkship I
units.special_text: Ral Nel Destroyer. This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each structure can only be triggered once.

units.name: Linkship II
units.special_text: Upgraded Ral Nel Destroyer. This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each linkship can trigger the same structure.

units.name: Last Dispatch
units.special_text: When this unit retreats, you may destroy 1 ship in the active system that does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

units.name: Alarum
units.special_text: At the end of a round of combat on this planet, you may move up to 2 of your ground forces to this planet from planets in adjacent systems.

technologies.name: Linkship II
technologies.text: Upgraded Ral Nel Destroyer unit.

technologies.name: Nanomachines
technologies.text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control OR repair all of your damaged units OR discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

promissory_note.name: Nano-Link Permit
promissory_note.text: After you activate a system: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens onto planets you control in the active system. Then, return this card to the Ral Nel player.

agent.name: Kan Rip Kel
agent.text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to draw 2 action cards; give 1 of those cards to another player.

commander.name: Watchful OJZ
commander.unlock: Be the last player to pass during the action phase.
commander.text: When you declare a retreat: Immediately retreat up to 2 of your ships from the active system to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Place a command token from your reinforcements into that system.

hero.name: Signal Intrusion
hero.text: After the last player passes: You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

home_system.special_setup_rules: Place the Sorrow (tile 94) where the home system would normally be placed and put an inactive breach in it. Place the actual home system (tile 118) in your play area.

starting_tech_ids.options: Choose one blue or red technology with no prerequisites.

abilities.name: Sundered
abilities.text: You cannot use wormholes other than epsilon wormholes. Other players' units that move or are placed into your home system are destroyed.

abilities.name: Incursion
abilities.text: When you activate a system that contains a breach, you may flip that breach; systems that contain active breaches are adjacent. At the end of the status phase, any player with ships in a system that contains an active breach may remove that breach.

abilities.name: Sea of Tears
abilities.text: When you create the game board, place the Sorrow (tile 94) where your home system would be placed, and place a inactive breach in it. The Sorrow is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 118) in your play area.

breakthrough.name: Resonance Generator
breakthrough.text: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains an active breach. ACTION: Exhaust this card to flip any breach or place an active breach in a non-home system that contains your units.

units.name: Exile I
units.special_text: Crimson Rebellion Destroyer.

units.name: Exile II
units.special_text: Upgraded Crimson Rebellion Destroyer. At the end of any player's combat in this unit's system or up to 2 systems away, you may place 1 active or inactive breach in that system.

units.name: Quietus
units.special_text: While this unit is in a system that contains an active breach, other players units in systems with active breaches lose all their unit abilities.

units.name: Revenant
units.special_text: DEPLOY: During the 'Commit Ground Forces' step of your tactical action in a system that contains an active breach, you may commit 1 mech, even if you have no units in the system.

technologies.name: Exile II
technologies.text: Upgraded Crimson Rebellion Destroyer unit.

technologies.name: Subatomic Splicer
technologies.text: When one of your ships is destroyed, you may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

promissory_note.name: Sever
promissory_note.text: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the sever token in a system that contains your units; wormholes in that system have no effect during movement. Remove the sever token and return this card to the Rebellion player at the end of the status phase.

agent.name: Ahk Ravin
agent.text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose 1 player. That player may swap the position of 2 of their ships in any systems; they may transport units when they swap.

commander.name: Ahk Siever
commander.unlock: Place a breach token in a system that contains another player's unit.
commander.text: At the end of a combat between any players: Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

hero.name: Homesick Phantom
hero.text: Fragment Reality: When you produce ships: You may place any of those ships onto this card. At the start of a space combat, you may purge this card to place all ships from this card into the active system.

starting_tech_ids.options: During Setup, research Technology twice (no prerequisite restrictions mentioned).

abilities.name: Research Team
abilities.text: When ground forces are committed, if your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

abilities.name: Oceanbound
abilities.text: When your units begin coexisting on a planet, gain an ocean card and ready it. Any time you have more ocean cards than there are planets that contain your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not.

breakthrough.name: Visionaria Select
breakthrough.text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to allow each other player to spend 3 trade goods and give you 1 promissory note. Each player that does may research a non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology. You also gain each technology researched in this way.

units.name: D.W.S. Luminous
units.special_text: This ship can move through systems that contain your units, even if other players' units are present; if it would, apply +1 to its move value for each of those systems.

units.name: Eanautic
units.special_text: When another player activates this system, if this unit is coexisting, you may move it and any of your infantry on its planet to a planet you control in your home system.

technologies.name: Radical Advancement
technologies.text: At the start of the status phase, you may replace one of your non-unit upgrade technologies with a technology of the same color that has exactly 1 more prerequisite.

technologies.name: Hydrothermal Mining
technologies.text: At the start of the status phase, gain 1 trade good for each ocean card in play.

promissory_note.name: Share Knowledge
promissory_note.text: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and gain 1 non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology that the Deepwrought player owns; place that technology on this card. Return tech and card at end of status phase.

agent.name: Doctor Carrina
agent.text: When another player researches a technology: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to ignore 1 prerequisite; if they do, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements into coexistence on a non-home planet they control.

commander.name: Aello
commander.unlock: Have an ocean card in play.
commander.text: When another player spends resources to research a technology: That player may reduce the cost by 1; if they do, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

hero.name: Ta Zern
hero.text: Wave Function Collapse: ACTION: Purge this card and a non-unit upgrade technology you own or from your deck; then, purge all cards with the same name owned by other players. Then, each player that purged a technology researches another technology.

starting_tech_ids.options: Choose one green or yellow technology with no prerequisites.

abilities.name: Plots within Plots
abilities.text: Score secret objectives already scored by others; place a facedown Plot card with that player's control token on it.

abilities.name: Puppets of the Blade
abilities.text: ACTION: If you have at least 1 plot card, purge components to become The Obsidian.

abilities.name: The Blade's Orchestra
abilities.text: When entering play, flip home system and plot cards; ready 'Hollow' planets if controlled.

abilities.name: Marionettes
abilities.text: The players whose tokens are on Plot cards are 'puppeted players' for The Obsidian.

firmament.name: The Sowing
firmament.text: Place up to 3 trade goods on this card at the start of status phase.

obsidian.name: The Reaping
obsidian.text: Place 1 trade good here when winning combat against a puppeted player; gain all goods on this card (plus equal from supply) at status phase.

firmament.name: Heaven's Eye
firmament.special: Repair and +1 move against puppeted players.

modes.firmament: May choose for units to coexist during ground combat commitment.
modes.obsidian: If coexisting when flipped, gain control of planet; opponent units now coexist.

text.firmament: When gained, put The Fracture into play.
text.obsidian: This technology cannot be researched; it carries over from Firmament.

text.firmament: Start of status: place 1 infantry on a home planet you control.
text.obsidian: Start of turn: destroy 1 adjacent enemy infantry.

firmament.name: Black Ops
firmament.text: Holder gains 2 TG and 2 CT; Firmament player places 1 facedown Plot with holder's token. Purge card.

obsidian.name: Malevolency
obsidian.text: At status end, non-Obsidian holder removes 1 fleet token. ACTION: Give this to a neighbor.

firmament.name: Myru Vos
firmament.text: Ships move through units and ignore SPACE CANNON.

obsidian.name: Vos Hollow
obsidian.text: When a ship is destroyed, opponent must destroy ship of same type.

firmament.name: Captain Aroz
firmament.unlock: Have a plot card in play.
firmament.text: Treat systems with your ships as controlled for secret objectives.

obsidian.name: Aroz Hollow
obsidian.text: +1 to combat rolls in The Fracture.

firmament.name: Sharsiss
firmament.text: ACTION: Place 1 plot with another player's token. Purge card.

obsidian.name: Sharsiss Hollow
obsidian.text: ACTION: Ready all of your planets. Purge card.

plots.name: Assail
plots.effect: +1 to combat/unit ability rolls against puppeted player.

plots.name: Enervate
plots.effect: Resolve puppeted player's secondary strategy abilities for free (Leadership primary instead).

plots.name: Extract
plots.effect: Reveal: Gain 1 non-faction tech from puppeted player.

plots.name: Seethe
plots.effect: Reveal: Destroy units on a puppeted non-home planet.

plots.name: Siphon
plots.effect: When puppeted player gains commodities, you gain trade goods.
